cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.NE 

The paper focuses on the problem of class imbalance in classification, which is a common issue in machine learning. The paper proposes a new measure to quantify the impact of class imbalance on classification performance, which is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. Specifically, the paper is likely to belong to the following sub-categories:

- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category is the most likely because the paper deals with a fundamental problem in machine learning, namely, how to handle class imbalance in classification. The proposed measure is based on the Bayes optimal classifier, which is a well-known concept in machine learning.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category is also likely because the paper deals with a problem that is relevant to artificial intelligence, namely, how to improve the performance of classifiers on imbalanced datasets. The proposed measure could be useful for developing more effective algorithms for handling class imbalance.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category is relevant because class imbalance is a common problem in computer vision tasks, such as object recognition and image segmentation. The proposed measure could be used to evaluate the performance of classifiers on imbalanced image datasets.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): This sub-category is relevant because the paper proposes a new measure for quantifying the impact of class imbalance on classification performance. The measure is based on the concept of instance complexity, which is a fundamental
